title: Felon jailed following shooting death of Jacksonville man
content:
A Jacksonville felon was jailed Sunday following the shooting death of a 19-year-old man at a detached garage apartment behind a house in the 1100 block of East 15th Street late Saturday night.
Frank Antonio Cameron, 59, is charged with manslaughter and possession of a weapon or ammunition by a convicted felon. He was being held without bail, according to Jacksonville Sheriff’s Office jail records.
Cameron was arrested after being questioned by detectives about the shooting of Marvin Levi Smith, 19, who was found dead with a gunshot wound to the head about 11:30 p.m. Saturday. The Sheriff’s Office said Cameron made “spontaneous comments” that the shooting was accidental.
Police said they recovered a gun at the scene. Address listings indicated Cameron and Smith were neighbors.
Cameron has prior convictions for felony possession of cocaine in Duval County, according to online county Clerk of Courts Office records.
Anyone with information about the shooting can call the Sheriff’s Office at (904) 630-0500 or Crime Stoppers at (866) 845-TIPS.
Teresa Stepzinski: (904) 359-4075
